intro: Scaevola stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fanflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Scaevola stenophylla is well adapted to arid environments and thrives in full sun.
